io.vertx.up.annotations

Annotation Type Wall


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Documented
 @Inherited
public @interface Wall

    Secure to provide wall to limit request 1. 401 Response 2. 403 Response It’s for security requirement.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String value
      Required for this wall, it provide following component building 1.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean define
      Whether current authorization mode is user-defined 1.
      int order
      Value for wall sequence, it’s for auth handler chain.
      String path
      Default value for all request limitation.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value

        Required for this wall, it provide following component building 1. Handler building 2. Provider building It’s mapped to node “secure” configuration, this node could configure following information 1. type: Standard type could identify Handler/Provider 2. provider: ( Standard Skip ) 3. handler: ( Standard Skip ) 4. user: ( Required ) 5. config: JsonObject for provider

        Returns:
        The required value for current building.

      • path

        public abstract String path

        Default value for all request limitation.

        Returns:
        the path that will be in security filter.
        Default:
        "/*"

      • order

        public abstract int order

        Value for wall sequence, it’s for auth handler chain. 1. All the wall class must contains different value 2. The major wall should be 0, others could invoke be 1, 2, 3. 3. The wall handler sequence should be triggered by 0,1,2,3… Multi handler mode needed for this value.

        Returns:
        handler order value that will be built into security chain.
        Default:
        0

      • define

        public abstract boolean define

        Whether current authorization mode is user-defined 1. The default value is false, it means that you must implement AuthHandler method annotated with @Authenticate 2. If default value is true, you must implement tha phase method as following: Annotated with @Phase Phase(HEADER): JsonObject parse(MultiMap headers, JsonObject body) Phase(AUTHORIZE): void authorize(JsonObject, AsyncHandler) Phase(ACCESS): User isAuthorized(String, Handler<AsyncResult> resultHandler)

        Returns:
        The phase that occurs in security limitation.
        Default:
        false
